summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019, demanding the production and preservation of extensive records related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054) and the MCC's operations, particularly concerning institutional counts, logs, and staff assignments, for an investigation into alleged violations of federal law. The subpoena requires an MCC employee to appear before the grand jury on September 10, 2019.

keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a grand jury investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, 1519, and 2, which relate to conspiracy, false statements, and destruction of evidence.
It specifically demands all documents related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054), including emails, internal correspondence, notes, and Form 292.

The subpoena requires the MCC to preserve and produce a wide range of records from June 1, 2019, onward, including institutional count slips, TRUSCOPE entries, various logs (visitor, attorney visit, lieutenant's, control center), and staff assignment records.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that the MCC voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena covers records from the Special Housing Unit (SHU), including posted picture files and post orders, and requests information on the High Risk List and any related communications.
